page.title: 09WIMBLEBALL RESERVOIR
page.content: The Somerset Trust for Nature Conservancy manages 29 acres as a nature reserve at the northern end of the lake and there are nature trails with leaflets available at the start near Bessom bridge. There are facilities for disabled people and severely disabled anglers may take their cars off the main car parks right down to the waters edge. Fishing in the lake is good and last year it was stocked with 20 000 trout! Traditional fly fishing is allowed, the season running from 1 May to 31 October and from one hour before sunrise to one hour after sunset. Daily permits cost Â£5.20 (Â£4.20 for OAP, students and RDP) and Â£1.20 for children under 16. The bag limit is 5 fish per day, 2 fish for children. Boats may be hired from 9.00 am each day.
